content:
Meal prep is a great way to save time, money, and reduce food waste. Adding a column to track your meal prep activities can help you optimize your process and make the most out of your efforts.

Here's an updated template with a new "Meal Prep" column:

**Food Expense Tracker Template:**

| **Date** | **Category** | **Item/Description** | **Cost** | **Location** | **Type** | **Cooking Method** | **Recipe** | **Meal Prep** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
|  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |

For the "Meal Prep" column, you can track the following information:

* **Prep Date**: The date you prepared the meal
* **Meal/Item**: A brief description of what you prepared (e.g., "chicken and rice", "lentil soup", "salad jars")
* **Portions**: The number of portions you prepared
* **Duration**: How long the meal prep lasted (e.g., "3 days", "5 lunches")
* **Notes**: Any additional notes or comments about the meal prep process (e.g., "needs more seasoning", "great for busy days")

By tracking your meal prep activities, you'll be able to:

* Optimize your meal prep routine and identify what works best for you
* Plan your meals and grocery lists more effectively
* Reduce food waste and save money
* Identify patterns and trends in your meal prep habits
* Refine your cooking skills and techniques

Remember to be flexible and adjust the "Meal Prep" column to fit your specific needs and goals. You can always add or modify columns as needed to make the template work best for you. Happy meal prepping!
